intro: Palicourea roraimae, commonly known as the Roraima palicourea, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and glossy, dark green leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of dense tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
